ECC8FCF3066442AFB93844FD8774D7AA.description: Construct a tool (e.g., rubric, checklist, self-evaluation form and peer-evaluation form) to assess the process and products involved in a student-directed study.

412C1EC1235F4E338208990D642100EB.description: Share the results of student-directed study through a display, presentation, performance, demonstration, song, game, commercial, fine art representation or research paper.

48FD28BFBB6F40CCB23D7C5DEEEE49D1.description: Assemble and reflect on a portfolio that demonstrates understanding of a Physical Education 30 topic of interest to the student.

BFE9A7A0A0A44852AE6928F57F4EDBE5.description: Explore one or more topics such as: educational qualifications of people involved in physical education related careers (e.g., physical therapist, firefighter and educator) through research and/or participation in events such as a career fair or job shadow; societal, health and legal rationale of why certifications (e.g., first aid/cardio pulmonary resuscitation, National Coaching Certification Program, refereeing, yoga/pilates/dance instructor, personal training system and certified personal trainer) exist in physical education occupations and volunteer positions; issue related to Physical Education 30, including developing materials to support the arguments for and against a debate position; features of a well-rounded fitness plan that incorporates key concepts of Physical Education 30; how well-being may become more/less of a priority in the future and what factors may help/hinder a balanced lifestyle; and, First Nations and Métis understandings of the interrelationships between physical, emotional, mental and spiritual health in creating a balanced lifestyle.

90BD3FFADC644E54A99791FBEB316FB9.description: Student-Directed Study Create and implement a plan to explore one or more topics of personal interest relevant to Physical Education 30.

CC63E9A5C5E543DE907E08FDEEE99107.description: Reflect on the effectiveness of psychological factors in supporting and maintaining participation in physical activities.

CED4D0EA457340BF8765F702408F862B.description: Incorporate a psychological factor to improve participation, enjoyment and/or performance in a self-selected physical activity.

F165D6DCCF2E46B7870D36B390BDF2AF.description: Examine the role of external (e.g., audience, weather and teammate expectations) and internal (e.g., fatigue, mental toughness and making a mistake) factors on an individual’s enjoyment, participation and performance in physical activity.

D40E6092524A42C58E3320786A50FD43.description: Examine psychological factors (e.g., self-talk, imagery/visualization, regulation of arousal, anxiety and relaxation, motivation, goal setting and concentration) that impact enjoyment, participation and performance in physical activities.

9A2D6642CD5F45F6AC9FD763BF790519.description: Discuss First Nations and Métis understandings of the interrelationships between physical, emotional, mental and spiritual health.

51CBD675E4124ACF85A5E725D8C014E4.description: Research the interrelationship between physical activity and physical, emotional, mental and spiritual health.

024EA2632DAE46B2A0EF241BCFD42960.description: Investigate personal motivations for participating in physical activity.

845D1F28FDA14B099E4105157DEB6B13.description: Exercise Psychology Investigate psychological factors that impact participation in physical activities.

ED86F143A74649E19BCF7FB46AE7E1B2.description: Explore the importance of participating in multiple activities to support physical development.

6F4ED574126C4CEF83B8BEA74D132150.description: Discuss the possible short- and long-term effects (e.g., lack of muscle growth and degeneration of joints) of over-training on an individual’s physiology.

2E80A7159B394ABD82FB8529C63CB27E.description: Investigate the importance of rest and active recovery as part of a fitness or training plan.

E880564D39094B0CB502F7B30CA7B735.description: Discuss the potential long-term effects of using improper movement patterns in a specific activity.

41AEEF81F2B84CC88DE7F29CEBC37376.description: Critique, for self and others, various weight training exercises and fitness activities for proper biomechanical execution.

9FC64DF824C449FBBF429A9D9C19FDA6.description: Identify, through participation, the movement patterns required to execute self-selected weight training exercises (e.g., proper form for bench press) and fitness activities (e.g., proper foot plant for long distance running).

4CC222F199C2408496CDEE2326804069.description: Critique, for self and others, various movement patterns and complex skills for proper biomechanical (e.g., rotation of a wrist, flexion of a joint and body position) execution.

0C098EDACF5849F69C1D08AFC1BA6F26.description: Identify, through participation, how to execute self-selected movement patterns and complex skills.

B4F29A9A300240768279B9AADE640126.description: Analyze the physiological benefits of short- and long-term training programs.

20E81E910DC2455681D799655B20432E.description: Physiology and Biomechanics Analyze physiological and biomechanical principles of movement.

D5E1AA1D147944279AE20CA4D551D643.description: Design a nutrition plan using informed nutritional choices and nutrient timing, to enhance performance in a self-selected physical activity.

5FA28A08DD3E4FADA02ABD168A5016A5.description: Critique how current nutritional trends (e.g., ketogenic, gluten free and high protein diets) might influence nutritional choices when participating in physical activity.

52EE613436DE47909BB4CE9B6F8F9601.description: Research the positive and negative effects of supplements (e.g., protein powder, creatine, branched-chain amino acids and steroids) and nutritional products (e.g., meal replacement drink, sports drink, energy gel and protein bar) on physical performance.

9F23911A5D264C3AB0956C2A89EF8EB0.description: Describe how nutrient timing (e.g., what and when to eat and drink) impacts participation and performance in an activ

52A45BCD1C0044CE9BE6AE4AA96EE660.description: Investigate the limitations of calorie counting as a method of determining how much food to eat to support participation in a physical activity.

504D0DA51E594D8D95D787D237297A16.description: Assess whether an individual’s daily caloric intake meets the daily energy requirements for participating in an activity.

183E77FD854C448AAC4CA50F77383553.description: Apply a basal metabolic rate formula with an activity factor to determine the daily caloric requirements when participating in an activity.

2B5BEECD92C24F05AB69BDEFEB828313.description: Identify how an individual’s nutritional choices for a self-selected physical activity may be influenced by factors such as type of activity, cost and geographical location.

77E1FA472A584351A2C056B87C7CBD8F.description: Assess how nutritional choices (e.g., vegetarianism, carbohydrate loading, intermittent fasting and high protein meal) might impact participation in a physical activity.

CCFCE9E466754AC4922344A6F323779F.description: Nutrition Analyze the role of nutritional choices to support participation in self-selected physical activities.

E3DD007000C54E9A9D236BC19204DEF6.description: Discuss the long-term physical, emotional, mental, and spiritual benefits of participation in First Nations and Métis games, dance and activities.

C6BFD8483C494DFD88D9155E88867369.description: Explore how leadership skills developed by planning and facilitating traditional games, dance and activities could be transferable to other contexts.

5AED69A0EC1A4255A98AC87EADB8CC59.description: Plan and facilitate traditional First Nations and Métis games (e.g., snowsnake, double ball, , lacrosse, leg wrestling and knuckle hop), dance (e.g., jigging, hoop and pow wow) and/or activities (e.g., snowshoeing and archery).

DCBEBF7055FB46CEBD5D8851E9DF02DE.description: Incorporate local, traditional First Nations and Métis ways of relating to and using the environment when leading physical activities (e.g., setting traps and fishing nets, snowshoeing, orienteering and navigation).

1B6EE00C57364917A5DC8B1B2A30F9B0.description: Investigate, and follow when appropriate, First Nations and Métis protocols, traditional knowledge and practices when engaging in physical activities.

BC0057631FEB4E95A5F27FAE1A16798F.description: Explain how the benefits of physical activity (e.g., endurance, flexibility and social skills) serve a purpose to meet the demands of lifelong activity such as hunting, observation skills or learning social values.

388140F133DE4CFCB8EA72C455A53AA0.description: Examine how First Nations and Métis ways of knowing inform people’s interactions with self, others and the environment through physical activity.

34516053863742BEA071AA2D8F34E295.description: First Nations and Métis Examine how First Nations and Métis perspectives and ways of knowing support lifelong learning through physical activity.

D92C204CA3844F46A6DCA36DEC83462F.description: Design and implement a plan to teach skills, tactics and strategies required to participate in an individual or multi-player activities and games.

94DF02BFCFE74E798ED8A7D88C456832.description: Develop strategic plans and tactics for individual and multi-player activities and games, including First Nations and Métis games and activities.

0384BCB85993425289019EF8486DAF98.description: Apply modifications to complex skills, tactics and strategies in activities and games, considering age and developmental stage, to enhance the confidence and competence of participants.

029EEBA4D4C746358B4CC1105A154480.description: Receive and incorporate feedback to improve skill proficiency in a variety of activities.

4E06D8D541E149408E84741A7ECA0681.description: View the execution of complex skills, performed by self or others, and provide feedback to increase proficiency.

4052E021718548F0A1158402D59A84EE.description: Demonstrate a complex skill in a specific activity and compare execution to that of a proficient performance.

9A9D9E25FBA24989BDE52FCBCE34B64C.description: Compare at least two complex skills (e.g., swinging a baseball bat and swinging a golf club) that have similar transferrable, basic movement patterns, strategies and performance cues.

ECD506DFB1BD42D6AA120926B3F5751B.description: Complex Skills, Tactics and Strategies Assess, through participation, the proficiency of skills, tactics and strategies in target, invasion/territorial, net/wall, striking/fielding and low organization and inventive activities.

D17C47BCFE564FAC8456E7700F84F81F.description: Propose potential solutions for challenges (e.g., certifications, resources and geographical location) that may limit participation in physical activities outside of the community.

6EEAC47738784E7EA8D22137F7418F69.description: Research and design a group physical activity outside of the community while considering logistical and financial details (e.g., destination, budget, equipment, nutrition and transportation).

6E29FB8F17CB4F76A375E3DB0B3851DD.description: Document and reflect on how participation in physical activities within multiple environments contributes to the lifelong well-being of self.

E52123E1B87C4289A69AA156E66CFE2A.description: Demonstrate respect for the natural environment through stewardship.

B3938BACB0B24772B3FA90F6C06D6DE8.description: Investigate, and follow when appropriate, First Nations and Métis protocols, traditional knowledge and practices when engaging in experiences within the outdoor environment.

45343441BD7B44D2B17EEAACBC3CB021.description: Analyze the advantages and disadvantages of technology (e.g., global positioning satellite, adjustable dumbbells, fitness and activity tracker, exercise ball and clothing/footwear) used during physical activities.

E288060A74214294B2BAC59A7CDD6F6D.description: Construct first aid and safety plans that support physical activity in multiple environments.

B4D6093A67E7471E844AC9E6578C48CE.description: Participate in physical activities (e.g., fitness, leisure and/or competitive) in multiple environments.

0B7C1905B3AE4B889C06112199147D19.description: Examine the potential lifelong benefits, for self and others, from participating in physical activities within multiple environments (e.g., in the air; on the land; on snow and ice; and in and on water).

9ED3ED5AD625498ABB8D2F1EFC1C6FF8.description: Movement in Multiple Environments Investigate how movement in multiple environments promotes lifelong physical activity for self and others.

C7A543CCBC9D4017879774BDDA7226D3.description: Discuss how self and community may benefit physically, emotionally, mentally and spiritually from participation in body management activities.

20F1ECC8F8D74AE78F5E29FCA5D01B71.description: Compile the participants’ perceptions of the impact of a community-based body management activity on their well-being.

A296490EF26544F5830D73E3577C3B72.description: Reflect on how participation in community-based body management activities has enhanced personal leadership skills.

648F0AE75BA149C3B8F04C89867CE7E6.description: Document your leadership role in a community-based body management activity.

B94D7F1E6575417683EBBE69F617388C.description: Demonstrate leadership through organization and participation in a chosen communitybased body management activity.

C4B80D0260BD47A68643F4B31B953783.description: Examine the physical, emotional, mental and spiritual benefits of participation in First Nations and Métis body management activities (e.g., jigging, hoop dance, pow wow and hand games).

807F13C0011F4858BD824FB82FF206F4.description: Propose body management activities that address a community need.

4F596FF33CC04855BBFEEE61012F8C10.description: Explore potential use of community space (e.g., rink, golf course, community green space, parks, walking/bike path, recreation center and public/private gyms) for body management activities.

6F0FC5174E534FC8B4F0059A125D3C48.description: Participate in body management activities (e.g., dance, pilates, yoga, aquatics, karate, walking, spinning/cycling, Zumba, Tai Chi and aerobics classes) that are available in the community.

5837AA5B03A7443CB26419F2CAA5EF87.description: Body Management Explore how participation in body management activities affects the wellbeing of self and community.

7566089A73E842E5955B05D2F9349AF8.description: Create a plan to identify events and organizations in a community that promote lifelong fitness.

7176E136465044A3B83BC20FE06532B1.description: Identify organizations in the community (e.g., fitness facilities, recreational sport leagues and community-based leisure services) that promote lifelong fitness.

3091E3B916E745E1AF07672BEB43EE63.description: Identify events (e.g., annual winter games, fun run, yoga in the park, cycling, Spartan race and pow wow) in the community that support lifelong fitness.

9F343EFB140E4C27B1DFE2907BB62021.description: Recommend physical activities that maximize an individual’s ability to improve aerobic thresholds (e.g., target and maximum heart rate).

40A8A8EDD6874880A8A640CC0B363151.description: Demonstrate how to incorporate suitable technologies (e.g., heart rate monitor, fitness and activity tracker, pedometer and video) to enhance physical activity goals.

840B6AE1627C48CBA2300434898F8E06.description: Implement various principles of training (e.g., specificity, progression and reversibility, overload and FITT: Frequency, Intensity, Time and Type) and reflect on how they address health- and skill-related components of fitness.

3BF86334F6724E30A566EC86509EEFE4.description: Reflect on questions such as: How might my lifestyle change after graduation?  What factors after graduation might influence how I pursue personal fitness goals?, How might my physical activity interests change as I age? and  What organizations and events exist to support my lifelong fitness?

E1083A90D980460C8AA6F38859B7B939.description: Reflect on perceived benefits for self and community from leadership in activity-based service learning.

EE502699476D42B4966925A12A096DE6.description: Reflect on how participation in activity-based service learning has enhanced personal leadership skills.

6465D0DA257949358E3034BE605B08FE.description: Document personal leadership in activity-based service learning.

E4E35D289A1F46A6A41AA8E1CF342F70.description: Participate, in a leadership role, in activity-based service learning.

9C0F8FFA7D564B35BCC208C3A217E8CE.description: Explore the requirements (e.g., safe contact in football, concussion protocol and criminal record check) for individuals seeking certification in a specific leadership role (e.g., coaching, officiating and volunteering).

C2A54BB5F38B4A6994C1AC2E98D02BBD.description: Investigate leadership roles in a variety of activity-based service learning opportunities in the community.

6576EB6B4D5043E495E7B593F874BEDC.description: Examine how First Nations and Métis ways of knowing guide the development of relationships with others and the environment through activity-based service learning.

AA0F4502B8C540509E86B2616A88D85C.description: Assess personal strengths and weaknesses in communication and building relationships with others.

97FF519E99304EE899130866BFF32FE2.description: Discuss what is known about leadership within physical activity (e.g., what leadership means; why it is important to give back to the community and province; what it means to be a mentor or an advocate in the community/province).

1A43161DD5224A56A7B32CD1F1A31BC2.description: Recognize the contributions that young adults have made to their community and province through activity-based service learning.

5D949E0F8D144DB88F8D7218FF5F2DFA.description: Leadership through Service Learning Assess, through participation, how leadership in activitybased service learning benefits self and community.
